density.note: Dynamic: use expansion coefficient to calculate density at other T

latentHeatOfVaporization.note: Energy required to boil water to steam at 100°C

evaporationCoefficient.note: Hertz-Knudsen α coefficient. Water has low value due to strong hydrogen bonding (Eames 1997). Range 0.01-1.0.

compressibility.note: How much density changes under pressure (use for high-altitude inverse)

antoineCoefficients.TminC_note: EMPIRICALLY VERIFIED RANGE MINIMUM: Below 1°C, water freezes at standard pressure. The low-temperature set (1-100°C) is used.
antoineCoefficients.TmaxC_note: EMPIRICALLY VERIFIED RANGE MAXIMUM: 374°C is water's critical point (liquid/gas distinction vanishes). The high-temperature set (99-374°C) covers above-boiling conditions.
antoineCoefficients.source: NIST Chemistry WebBook - two coefficient sets covering 1-374°C
antoineCoefficients.note: Two overlapping sets provide full liquid range. Default coefficients are for common use (1-100°C). Physics engine should select appropriate set based on expected temperature range.

electricalConductivity.note: Pure water is a poor conductor
electricalConductivity.applicationUse: Shows baseline; any dissolved ions dramatically increase conductivity
